result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A Coats was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-01-2015; OR 3 days Huber for Contempt for non-compliance with court order.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Starting Immediately.

Can be transferred to Milwaukee County if served in the facility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha A Coats

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:39 pm for a plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Samantha A Coats in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court was going to withheld sentence and put the defendant on probration.  Defendant rejects probation.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed Sentence:   20 days in County Jail with Huber release standard conditions, commencing immediately.  Can be transferred to Milwaukee County if served in the facility. 
Costs: $ 243.00
To to be paid at the rate of $50  per month commencing 9/1/2015;  OR 3 days huber for contempt for non-compliance with court order.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
